item.title: EC to start disposing appeals against decisions on nomination papers
item.description: The Election Commission on Saturday will kick off the nine-day hearing and disposal of the appeal petitions filed against the acceptance and rejection of nomination papers during the scrutiny as the deadline for receiving such petitions expired on Friday. item.title: Suspects infiltrated Osman Hadi’s campaign to ‘disrupt election’: chargesheet
item.description: The murder of Inqilab Moncho Convenor Sharif Osman bin Hadi was carried out to “obstruct” the parliamentary election, according to a chargesheet submitted by investigators. The chargesheet says suspect Faisal Karim Masud and his associates infiltrated Hadi’s election campaign wit

item.title: Fine-grain rice prices rise, vegetables refuse to dip
item.description: The arrival of BRRI-28 rice in the market despite old stocks has failed to ease prices, with finer rice varieties rising by up to Tk 5 per kg within a week, while coarse rice prices have remained largely unchanged. Visits to Shantinagar, Segunbagicha and Jatrabari markets in Dhaka on Friday, the w

item.title: Police ‘bar’ devotees from High Court shrine
item.description: Police have allegedly barred attendance at the annual urs at the shrine of Shah Khaza Sharfuddin Chishti, located next to the High Court, devotees have said. Police, however, said the daytime observances of the urs had already ended, and that some devotees remained at the site afterwards. They we

item.title: Tailwinds may lift economic growth to 5.0pc in FY26
item.description: Bangladesh's slow-pace economic growth may be ramped up to 5.0 per cent by tailwinds before this fiscal year ends on June 30, 2026, as estimated by BMI, a unit of Fitch Ratings. "We maintain our growth forecast of 5.0 per cent for FY2025/26," the global ratings agency's unit says in its late

item.title: Mirza Fakhrul’s income edges up in seven years
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir has declared an annual income of around Tk 1.2 million and total assets worth more than Tk 15 million in his election affidavit. A comparison with his previous affidavit shows that while his annual income has increase

item.title: Tarique’s visit to northern region postponed
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chief Tarique Rahman has postponed his planned visit to the northern region following a request from the Election Commission (EC). The decision was announced following a meeting of the party’s National Standing Committee on Friday night. The four-day visit

item.title: 18 detained over teacher hiring question leaks
item.description: Police have detained 18 people in Naogaon on charges of question paper leaks and fraud in the recruitment exams for assistant teachers at government primary schools. Naogaon District Police Superintendent Mohammad Tarequl Islam revealed the matter at a press conference around 7pm on Friday. The s

item.title: Role of judgment in risk-based supervision
item.description: Risk-based supervision is one of the most important changes in modern banking supervision. It is important not because it creates new rules, but because it changes how supervisors think and work. In the past, supervisors treated most banks in the same way. item.title: Dhaka needs public shuttle bus service
item.description: To facilitate commute for visitors to the 30th Dhaka International Trade Fair, taking place at the Bangladesh-China Friendship Exhibition Centre in Purbachal, the Bangladesh Road Transport Corporation (BRTC) has pressed into service shuttle buses. item.title: Discovering the wonders of Bangladesh
item.description: Vacationing is no longer a luxury enjoyed by a select few but an increasingly routine part of contemporary life. item.title: Meeting fertiliser needs of Boro farmers
item.description: Chronic shortage of natural gas has been hampering fertiliser production especially at the five urea fertiliser-producing plants operated by the state-owned Bangladesh Chemical Industries Corporation (BCIC).
